title: chigo
author: chigo
content: QuoteWhat is Kingpyn Boxing?Kingpyn is an organisation that puts on fights between high-profile individuals not usually known for their boxing.These have often been influencers and YouTube stars, taking advantage of the crossover appeal of celebrities stepping into the ring.Among Kingpyn's fights in 2022, Brooke beat AJ Bunker in the co-headline bout of a card at London's O2 Indigo billed as "the biggest TikTok boxing event of the year."Read More https://www.sportingnews.com/us/boxing/news/what-kingpyn-boxing-schedule-results-bracket-whindersson/u0ljq42hukrlwjtv6gqgklktI'm still not very familiar with this competition, is it different from boxing in general? but I see some of my friends are excited about this competition, do you want to bet on this boxing competition when you have a little information about the boxers?

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: They may be famous outside the crypto community but to most Bitcoiners, they are unknown. As much as we want to bet on boxing bouts, there are just uninteresting exhibition fights like the ones promoted by this Kingpyn.  @YuginKadoya posted this in the other thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.msg62532811#msg62532811The Logans really influenced a lot of YouTubers to also try boxing but this one looks like a reality TV.

comments.author: macson
comments.body: do you follow their twitter account, guys https://twitter.com/kingpynboxing/status/1680299154801672193?  in my opinion kingpyn is not a boxing, it's just entertainment that is deliberately made for influencers to get more attention from fans.i quite like boxing but i will not bet my money on kingpyn boxing, they are not natural boxers, they are just influencers, for me the end result that is created in every kingpyn fight that happens will not be much different from WWE (it's already set).  once again, don't bet your money on things you don't know or just an entertainment event.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: I agree that this is more on entertainment side than a boxing sports since people who are involved are not used to boxing disciplines.  There is also a high possibility that this is a scripted fight where the winner is already decided even before the fight started.  This also reminds me of a tv program  called The Grudge Match with some variation since the tv program is about a getting revenge or setting dispute between the two people while this KINGPYN is possibly getting money and popularity out of their boxing performance.

comments.author: stomachgrowls
comments.body: Quote from: chigo on July 15, 2023, 09:56:42 AMQuoteWhat is Kingpyn Boxing?Kingpyn is an organisation that puts on fights between high-profile individuals not usually known for their boxing.These have often been influencers and YouTube stars, taking advantage of the crossover appeal of celebrities stepping into the ring.Among Kingpyn's fights in 2022, Brooke beat AJ Bunker in the co-headline bout of a card at London's O2 Indigo billed as "the biggest TikTok boxing event of the year."Read More https://www.sportingnews.com/us/boxing/news/what-kingpyn-boxing-schedule-results-bracket-whindersson/u0ljq42hukrlwjtv6gqgklktI'm still not very familiar with this competition, is it different from boxing in general? but I see some of my friends are excited about this competition, do you want to bet on this boxing competition when you have a little information about the boxers?We do have that kind of boxing match ups but the fighters involved are to those people who are really that popular on social media or youtube or on other similar people which making out some arrangement on having a fight which i do consider not to be that in having that a real boxing. Everything is really that been hyped up and of course this would really be pertaining on how they would really be able to make money.Usually they would really be making those fake conflicts and argumentation on which they would really make things to be heated up and on the time that it would be making some hype then this is where they do mostly prefer because we know that the more people watching the more money that they could generate which its not really shocking anymore in todays world where everything is really been that rolled out with having that very common intent.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: they call this "celebrity boxing trend" not sure who coined it but seem to be the trend since the time of crossover fights like conor vs floyd and then there's logan brothers. youtubers and then onlyfans celeb is the best exhibition so far lolrecently i saw a news about Buakaw Against Manny Pacquiao Boxing Superfight, this one is also crossover fight. the last time Pacquiao fought was DK Yoo, didn't look like an exhibition.https://beyondkick.com/news/buakaw-pacquiao-2024/

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: I will definitely not bet my money on this type of event, because the tendency of exhibition fights is that the fighters do not fight desperately for a victory, for they do not feel any great danger to their physical integrity during the fight, they relax because they know that their opponent is not going to take this fight very seriously, but since they have to entertain the public, the two fighters create a character and everything becomes a fight in which both fighters act outI don't know if they agree before the fight what each fighter should do, but I don't see them fighting seriously, although there was a case of a youtuber and a fighter who scheduled a boxing match and fought seriously and strange as it seems, the youtuber left with a victory and laughed in the face of the fighter who lost the fight, but apart from that case, I haven't seen any more famous fights that had to fight in a very serious way, anyway I wouldn't bet on this type of event because I simply wouldn't have how to analyze the fight and choose who could win the fight

comments.author: jakelyson
comments.body: Quote from: bittraffic on July 15, 2023, 12:09:33 PMThey may be famous outside the crypto community but to most Bitcoiners, they are unknown. As much as we want to bet on boxing bouts, there are just uninteresting exhibition fights like the ones promoted by this Kingpyn.  @YuginKadoya posted this in the other thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.msg62532811#msg62532811The Logans really influenced a lot of YouTubers to also try boxing but this one looks like a reality TV.WOW! great finding that in the Boxing Speculation thread, I really think no one is really engaging with that kind of Topic meaning no one is interested in it, and regarding the type of boxing YouTubers, content creators, or influencers are wearing the gloves and getting it on in the ring and if you guys want to watch the whole fight on the recent event here is the link, https://www.youtube.com/@KingpynBoxing you could see the boxers there and their previous fights, but I haven't seen the latest fight but surely it will be posted in there I think, Surely, in my opinion, I don't really think there will be people that will be engaging in this kind of boxing actually they are even below Average for a boxer or to be a boxer, for sure for me most of these fights are really lame while this fight have become a tournament for sure and for me it was not worth the time and not worth the money to be betting on, aswell, so for me in my honest opinion go and watch it if you want to be entertained because the fight was really entertaining well for some but surely for me it was not really talks the fight,

fight that happens will not be much different from WWE (it's already set).  once again, don't bet your money on things you don't know or just an entertainment event.Well, actually I don't really know most of the fighters in the KingPyn boxing event and the only one that I knew about was Elle Brooke that have lost recently with her fight with Jully Poca and if you don't know she is also an adult come across with this post, so there is someone that wants to engage with this topic but was outside that thread,

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: YuginKadoya on July 17, 2023, 09:12:38 AMWell, actually I don't really know most of the fighters in the KingPyn boxing event and the only one that I knew about was Elle Brooke that have lost recently with her fight with Jully Poca and if you don't know she is also an adult star that is why I have posted this on that thread to gain attention but surely no one wants to discuss about it, but surely I move on with it and go with other topics in the MMA and boxing and then I come across with this post, so there is someone that wants to engage with this topic but was outside that thread, Many of us are not aware of this but checking their official Youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/@KingpynBoxing, They have 100k subscribers and 228 videos not bad but they still have a long way to go, unless they got popular personalities or influencers to participate in their promotion, I don't know many of these fighters since they are supported by DAZN it's only a matter of time before they reach popularity, it's hard to bet on these fighters under this promotion especially those who are just starting out and with no videos to analyze their style, but who knows UFC was not popular then but look where they are now.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinPanther on July 15, 2023, 08:21:49 PMI agree that this is more on entertainment side than a boxing sports since people who are involved are not used to boxing disciplines.  There is also a high possibility that this is a scripted fight where the winner is already decided even before the fight started.  This also reminds me of a tv program  called The Grudge Match with some variation since the tv program is about a getting revenge or setting dispute between the two people while this KINGPYN is possibly getting money and popularity out of their boxing performance.Exactly! Because if this is just real we always see some blood gushing from their faces often and we see some real skills from their fighters but this is not how traditional boxing works because this is just a mere entertainment not gonna be fit for the crypto community to talk about. Because what the crypto community wants are sports you don't really have any idea about it's ending like boxing and basketball so they will gonna talk about the games and the fight just before it happens.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Not really interested in this type of boxing event. They are made because these influencers have huge followers and fans which made some boxing promoters and networks interested for business purposes. And of course, many casuals with zero to little knowledge of boxing will watch these fights because they thought these are super fights and are real.The only time I watched a live celebrity match was when I tuned in during the middle of the fight between Jake Paul and grandpa MMA legend, Anderson Silva. It could be real but there is also a part of me that tells Silva was controlling himself not to seriously spank the special child.And of course, I will try to watch Fury-Ngannou. I would love to see the inactive and slow-as-turtle Francis Ngannou brutally put Belly Duck Fury to sleep. It's a mission impossible though as Fury will humiliate Ngannou with his stiff jabs. Ngannou will be gassed out after 3 or 4 rounds and might beat himself by not answering the bell. Still, I love to know that Francis gets paid 8 digits after escaping from his shogun and dictator.

comments.author: SirLancelot
comments.body: Quote from: YuginKadoya on July 17, 2023, 09:12:38 AMQuote from: bittraffic on July 15, 2023, 12:09:33 PMThey may be famous outside the crypto community but to most Bitcoiners, they are unknown. As much as we want to bet on boxing bouts, there are just uninteresting exhibition fights like the ones promoted by this Kingpyn.  @YuginKadoya posted this in the other thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.msg62532811#msg62532811The Logans really influenced a lot of YouTubers to also try boxing but this one looks like a reality TV.Thanks for sharing it here and surely enough nobody really wants to engage with a discussion about it maybe because it is consist of influencers and not actual boxers but I posted it there to make people aware that there is some event that is going to happen but consist of non-boxers and just YouTubers, influencers, Onlyfan girls, and anything under the sun and they have provided an event that is surely out of the ordinary, for sure no one really are discussing this kind of things and I really don't see this profitable if there are no sponsors but I think they have, and I surely don't know any deeper information why they are doing this kind of things but still I really though this was interesting so I have posted it there, It seems you are right because there's no users who quoted the last post you made but maybe there are some of them noticed and read it and maybe they start to research more of it? Like me for example, it's my first time hearing the keyword so I search for more info and see that it was the same as boxing but if people already embraced boxing and other variations related to it like MMA then why not this one? You're right, some fighters are a OnlyFans star. She even did flash her boobs after a win but it was censored. Well, what can we expect from her? It was the nature of her career so things like that are already expected to happen. Maybe this sport was profitable as there might be betting site who offer a market for this? Their main point on why they are doing it is prolly to give people an entertainment.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: chigo on July 15, 2023, 09:56:42 AMI'm still not very familiar with this competition, is it different from boxing in general? but I see some of my friends are excited about this competition, do you want to bet on this boxing competition when you have a little information about the boxers?I think it's not that different from boxing but what you'll see here are just amateurs or no knowledge how boxing pro is done. This is mostly for the views and money and nothing that interesting in the first place. I think it's a blind bet if you don't know anything about them at all, they don't have stats to look at and you may just ended up getting information about the hype they do on social media, nothing more.

comments.author: bittraffic

As much as we want to bet on boxing bouts, there are just uninteresting exhibition fights like the ones promoted by this Kingpyn.  @YuginKadoya posted this in the other thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5370631.msg62532811#msg62532811The Logans really influenced a lot of YouTubers to also try boxing but this one looks like a reality TV.Thanks for sharing it here and surely enough nobody really wants to engage with a discussion about it maybe because it is consist of influencers and not actual boxers but I posted it there to make people aware that there is some event that is going to happen but consist of non-boxers and just YouTubers, influencers, Onlyfan girls, and anything under the sun and they have provided an event that is surely out of the ordinary, for sure no one really are discussing this kind of things and I really don't see this profitable if there are no sponsors but I think they have, and I surely don't know any deeper information why they are doing this kind of things but still I really though this was interesting so I have posted it there, It seems you are right because there's no users who quoted the last post you made but maybe there are some of them noticed and read it and maybe they start to research more of it? Like me for example, it's my first time hearing the keyword so I search for more info and see that it was the same as boxing but if people already embraced boxing and other variations related to it like MMA then why not this one? You're right, some fighters are a OnlyFans star. She even did flash her boobs after a win but it was censored. Well, what can we expect from her? It was the nature of her career so things like that are already expected to happen. Maybe this sport was profitable as there might be betting site who offer a market for this? Their main point on why they are doing it is prolly to give people an entertainment.Flashing her boobs! Dang, I gotta see that. I bet that's what the fans paid for so it's definitely not fair to censor it. It's not surprising lots of people come but looks like they are not in an arena, people are just sitting in a lawn chairs. If this Kingpin promotion gonna do this regularly, they gonna make a lot of onlyfans celebrities join. King Kenny seems to have boxing skills, he's got head movement but also showboating. They should invite Jake Logan as it can attract more ticket buyers.

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: Quote from: SirLancelot on July 19, 2023, 06:09:16 PMIt seems you are right because there's no users who quoted the last post you made but maybe there are some of them noticed and read it and maybe they start to research more of it? Like me for example, it's my first time hearing the keyword so I search for more info and see that it was the same as boxing but if people already embraced boxing and other variations related to it like MMA then why not this one? You're right, some fighters are a OnlyFans star. She even did flash her boobs after a win but it was censored. Well, what can we expect from her? It was the nature of her career so things like that are already expected to happen. Maybe this sport was profitable as there might be betting site who offer a market for this? Their main point on why they are doing it is prolly to give people an entertainment.The incident was truly unexpected, and Kingpyn's Boxing management took firm steps to dampen the uproar that occurred as a result of the uncensored action. there are also many comments from people who say that kingpyn is not a professional boxing show, but just entertainment for the fans of each of the fighting influencers. I'm not interested in betting on kingpyn boxing, I don't know the history of each fighter that will compete, I will avoid betting on kingpyn boxing as much as possible.
